ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHA=value ] 
      
Specifies the confidence level size to use in computing the confidence limits
in the model selection list files.

[Syntax: BACK=number ] 
      
Specifies the number of observations before the end of the data.

[Syntax: BASENAME=SAS-name ] 
      
Prefixes the model specification file name or the model selection list file
name or both.

[Syntax: CRITERION=option ] 
      
Prefixes the model specification file name or the model selection list file
name or both.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: mean absolute error percent of standard deviation
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: median absolute error percent of standard deviation
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip14: geometric mean absolute error percent of standard deviation
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip18: symmetric mean absolute predictive percent error

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=SAS data set ] 
      
Specifies the name of the SAS data set that contains the time series. If the
DATA= option is not specified, the most recently created SAS data set is used.

[Syntax: DELAYEVENT=number ] 
      
Specifies the delay lag for the events. If the option is not specified, the
delay lag for the events is set to zero by default.

[Syntax: DELAYINPUT=number ] 
      
Specifies the delay lag for the inputs. If the option is not specified, the
delay lag for the inputs is appropriately chosen by the procedure.

[Syntax: ENTRYPCT=number ] 
      
Specifies a threshold to check the percentage increment of the criterion
between two candidate models. The ENTRYPCT=value should be in (0,100); the
default is ENTRYPCT=0.1.

[Syntax: ERRORCONTROL=( SEVERITY= ( severity-options) 
  STAGE= ( stage-options) MAXMESSAGE=number) ] 
      
Allows finer control of message printing. The error severity level and the
HPFDIAGNOSE procedure processing stages are set independently.

[Syntax: EVENTBY=SAS data set ] 
      
Specifies the name of the event data set that contains the events for specific
BY groups that are created by DATA steps.

[Syntax: EXCEPTIONS=except-option ] 
      
Specifies the desired handling of arithmetic exceptions during the run.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that PROC HPFDIAGNOSE stop on an arithmetic exception.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that PROC HPFDIAGNOSE skip the generation of diagnostic output for the  variable that produces the exception in the current BY group.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: HOLDOUT=number ] 
      
Specifies the size of the holdout sample to be used for model selection.

[Syntax: HOLDOUTPCT=value ] 
      
Specifies the size of the holdout sample as a percentage of the length of the
dependent time series.

[Syntax: INEST=SAS data set ] 
      
Contains information that maps forecast variables to models or selection lists,
and data set variables to model variables.

[Syntax: INEVENT=SAS data set ] 
      
Specifies the name of the event data set that contains the event definitions
created by the HPFEVENTS procedure.

[Syntax: INPUTMISSINGPCT=value ] 
      
Specifies the size of the missing observation as a percentage of the length of
the input time series.

[Syntax: INSELECTNAME=SAS-name ] 
      
Specifies the name of a catalog entry that serves as a model selection list.

[Syntax: MINOBS=(SEASON=number TREND=number) ] 
      
SEASON= 
specifies that no seasonal model is fitted to any series with fewer nonmissing
observations than number  (season length). The value of number must be greater
than or equal to 1. The default is number = 2. 

TREND= 
specifies that no trend model is fitted to any series with fewer nonmissing
observations than number . The value of number must be greater than or equal
to 1. The default is number = 1.

[Syntax: NODIAGNOSE ] 
      
Specifies that the series is not diagnosed. If the INSELECTNAME= option and
OUTEST= option are specified, the existing model specification files are
written to the OUTEST data set.

[Syntax: NOINESTOPTS ] 
      
Specifies that the selection lists referred to by the INEST= option are not
used in the diagnosed version.

[Syntax: OUTEST=SAS data set ] 
      
Contains information that maps data set variables to model symbols and
references model specification files and model selection list files.

[Syntax: OUTOUTLIER=SAS data set ] 
      
Contains information that is associated with the detected outliers.

[Syntax: OUTPROCINFO= SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the summary information of the processing
done by PROC HPFDIAGNOSE . It is particularly useful for easy programmatic
assessment of the status of the procedure’s execution via a data set instead of
looking at or parsing the SAS log.

[Syntax: PREFILTER=MISSING | YES | EXTREME | BOTH ] 
      
Specifies handling missing and extreme values prior to diagnostic tests.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Smoothed values for missing data are applied for tentative order selection and missing  values are used for the final diagnostics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Smoothed values for missing data are applied to overall diagnoses. This option is the default.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Extreme values set to missing for a tentative ARIMA model and extreme values are used for  the final ARIMAX model diagnostics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: This value is equivalent to both YES and EXTREME.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PRINT=NONE | SHORT | LONG | ALL ] 
      
Specifies the print option.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Suppresses the printed output. This option is the default.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Prints the model specifications. This option also prints only the significant input  variables, events, and outliers.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Prints the summary of the transform, the stationarity test, and the determination of  ARMA order in addition to all of the information printed by PRINT=SHORT.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Prints the details of the stationarity test and the determination of ARMA order. This  option prints the detail information about all input variables and events under  consideration.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: REPOSITORY=catalog ] 
      
Contains information about model specification files and model selection list
files.

[Syntax: RETAINCHOOSE=YES | NO | TRUE | FALSE ] 
      
Specifies that the CHOOSE= option in the HPFSELECT procedure is respected when
re-diagnosing series. The default is RETAINCHOOSE=YES.

[Syntax: SEASONALITY=number ] 
      
Specifies the length of the seasonal cycle. The number should be a positive
integer.

[Syntax: SELECTINPUT=SELECT | ALL | number ] 
      
Specifies the maximum number of the input variables to select.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Selects the input variables that satisfy the criteria (noncollinearity, nonnegative delay,  smaller AIC). This option is the default.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Selects the input variables that satisfy the criteria (noncollinearity, nonnegative delay).

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SELECTEVENT=SELECT | ALL |number ] 
      
Specifies the maximum number of events to select.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Selects the events that satisfy the criteria (noncollinearity, smaller AIC). This  option is the default.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Selects the events that satisfy the criteria (noncollinearity).

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SIGLEVEL=value ] 
      
Specifies the cutoff value for all diagnostic tests such as log transformation,
stationarity, tentative ARMA order selection, and significance of UCM
components.

[Syntax: SELECTBASE=SAS-name ] 
      
Prefixes the model selection list file name.

[Syntax: SPECBASE=SAS-name ] 
      
Prefixes the model specification file name.

[Syntax: TESTINPUT=TRANSFORM | TREND | BOTH ] 
      
If this option is not specified, the same differencing is applied to the input
variables as is used for the variable to be forecast, and no transformation is
applied to the input variables.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the log transform testing of the input variables is applied independently  of the variable to be forecast.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the trend testing of the input variables is applied independently of the  variable to be forecast.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the log transform and trend testing of the input variables are applied  independently of the variable to be forecast.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ADJUST variable = ( variable-list ) / options ;
      
The ADJUST statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose
accumulated values are used to adjust the dependent values. Adjustments are
performed before diagnostics.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OPERATION=option ] 
      
Specifies how the adjustments are applied to the forecast variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No adjustment operation is performed. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Variables listed in the adjustment statement are added to the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Variables listed in the adjustment statement are subtracted from the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Dependent variable is multiplied by variables listed in the adjustment statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Dependent variable is divided by variables listed in the adjustment statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Dependent variable is set to the minimum of the dependent variable and all variables  listed in the adjustment statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Dependent variable is set to the maximum of the dependent variable and all variables  listed in the adjustment statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: None

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ARIMAX <options>; 
      
The HPFDIAGNOSE procedure performs the intermittency test first. If the series
is intermittent, an intermittent demand model is fitted to the data and the
ARIMAX statement is not applicable. If the series is not intermittent, an
ARIMAX model is fitted to the data.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PERROR=(number : number) ] 
      
Specifies the range of the AR order for obtaining the error series used in the
MINIC method. The default is (maxp:maxp+maxq).

[Syntax: P=(number : number) (number : number) ] 
      
Specifies the range of the nonseasonal and seasonal AR orders. The default 
is (0:5)(0:2).

[Syntax: Q=(number : number) (number : number) ] 
      
Specifies the range of the nonseasonal and seasonal MA orders. The default 
is (0:5)(0:2).

[Syntax: DEN=(number : number) ] 
      
Specifies the range of the denominator order of the transfer function. The
default is (0:2).

[Syntax: NUM=(number : number) ] 
      
Specifies the range of the numerator order of the transfer function. The 
default is (0:2).

[Syntax: CRITERION=AIC | SBC ] 
      
Specifies the criterion for the tentative ARMA order selection. The default is
CRITERION=SBC.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: AIC

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SIGLEVEL=value ] 
      
Specifies the significance level to use as a cutoff value to decide the AR and MA orders.

[Syntax: ESTMETHOD=CLS | ULS | ML ] 
      
Specifies the method for choosing the tentative ARMA orders (Choi 1992; Tsay and Tiao 1984).

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Conditional least squares method. This option is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: METHOD=ESACF | MINIC | SCAN ] 
      
Specifies the method for choosing the tentative ARMA orders (Choi 1992; Tsay and Tiao 1984).

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Extended sample autocorrelation function.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Minimum information criterion. This option is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUTLIER=(options) ] 
      
Specifies outlier detection in an ARIMAX model (de Jong and Penzer 1998).

[Syntax: IDENTIFYORDER=ARIMA | REG | BOTH ] 
      
Specifies the identification order when inputs and events are specified.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Finds an ARIMA model for the error series first and then chooses significant  inputs and events. This option is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Finds a regression model first and then decides the AR and MA polynomial orders.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Fits models by using the two methods and determines the better model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: IDENTIFYORDER=ARIMA | REG | BOTH ] 
      
Specifies to refine insignificant parameters of the final model, identify the
factors to refine, and identify the order of factors.

[Syntax: NOINT | NOCONSTANT ] 
      
Suppresses the intercept (constant) term.

Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

[Syntax: METHOD=BEST | BESTN | BESTS ] 
      
Specifies the identification order when inputs and events are specified.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Fits the best candidate smoothing model (SIMPLE, DOUBLE, LINEAR, DAMPTREND, SEASONAL,  WINTERS, ADDWINTERS). This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Fits the best candidate nonseasonal smoothing model (SIMPLE, DOUBLE, LINEAR, DAMPTREND).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Fits the best candidate seasonal smoothing model (SEASONAL, WINTERS, ADDWINTERS).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: REQUIRED=YES | MAYBE | NO ] 
      
The same differencing is applied to the events as is used for the variables to
be forecast. No functional transformations are applied to the events.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the events be included in the model as long as the model does not  fail to be diagnosed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the events be included in the model as long as the parameters of  events are significant.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the events be included in the model as long as the parameters of  events are significant and the increment of the value of criterion exceeds a  threshold. The default is REQUIRED=NO.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FORECAST variables / < / options> ;
      
Any number of FORECAST statements can be used in the HPFDIAGNOSE procedure. The
FORECAST statement lists the variables in the DATA= data set to be diagnosed.
The variables are dependent or response variables that you want to forecast in
the HPFENGINE procedure.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: None

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ID variable options;
      
The ID statement names a numeric variable that identifies observations in the
input and output data sets. The ID variable’s values are assumed to be SAS
date, time, or datetime values. In addition, the ID statement specifies the
(desired) frequency associated with the time series. The ID statement options
also specify how the observations are accumulated and how the time ID values
are aligned to form the time series. The information specified affects all
variables specified in subsequent FORECAST statements. If the ID statement is
specified, the INTERVAL= option must also be specified. If an ID statement is
not specified, the observation number (with respect to the BY group) is used as
the time ID.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: None

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALIGN=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: END=option ] 
      
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the end of the
data. If the last time ID variable value is less than the END= value, the
series is extended with missing values.

[Syntax: INTERVAL=interval ] 
      
Specifies the frequency of the input time series.

[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: START=option ] 
      
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the beginning of
the data.

[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INTERMITTENT=number ] 
      
Specifies a number greater than one that is used to determine whether or not a
time series is intermittent.

[Syntax: BASE=AUTO | value ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The time series properties are used to automatically adjust the time series.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: INPUT variables < / options>;
      
Any number of INPUT statements can be used in the HPFDIAGNOSE procedure. The
INPUT statement lists the variables in the DATA= data set to be diagnosed as
regressors. The variables are independent or predictor variables to be used to
forecast dependent or response variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: REQUIRED=YES | MAYBE | NO ] 
      
Either the POSITIVE or NEGATIVE option with parentheses can follow the
REQUIRED= option. For examples REQUIRED=YES(POSITIVE) and REQUIRED=MAYBE(NEGATIVE). 
When the REQUIRED=YES(POSITIVE) option is specified, if its coefficient is negative, 
then the input variable drops out from the model.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the input variables be included in the model as long as the model  does not fail to be diagnosed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the input variables be included in the model as long as their  parameters are significant.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the input variables be included in the model as long as their  parameters are significant and the increment of the value of criterion exceeds  a threshold.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: None

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: P=number ] 
      
Specifies the autoregressive order for the log transform test.

[Syntax: SIGLEVEL=value ] 
      
Specifies the significance level to use as a cutoff value to decide whether or
not the series requires a log transformation.

[Syntax: TRANSOPT=MEAN | MEDIAN ] 
      
Specifies whether mean or median forecasts are produced. If no transformation
is applied to the series, then the mean and median forecasts are identical.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The inverse transform produces mean forecasts. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The inverse transform produces median forecasts.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TYPE=AUTO | LOG | NONE | SQRT | LOGISTIC | BOXCOX(value) ] 
      
Specifies the type of functional transformation.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Automatically choose between NONE and LOG based on model selection criteria. If the TRANSFORM statement is specified but the TYPE= option is not specified, then TYPE=AUTO is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: No transformation is applied. If the TRANSFORM statement is not specified, TYPE=NONE is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Box-Cox transformation with a parameter value where the value is between –5 and 5. The default is BOXCOX(1).

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TREND <options>;
      
A TREND statement can be used to test whether the dependent series requires
simple or seasonal differencing, or both. The augmented Dickey-Fuller test
(Dickey and Fuller 1979) is used for the simple unit root test.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DIFF=AUTO | NONE | number | (0 : number) ] 
      
Specifies differencing to be used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Tests for simple differencing. This option is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that no simple differencing be used.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SDIFF=AUTO | NONE | number ] 
      
Specifies seasonal differencing to be used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Tests for seasonal differencing. This option is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that no seasonal differencing be used.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: P=number ] 
      
Specifies the autoregressive order for the augmented unit root tests and a seasonality test.

[Syntax: SIGLEVEL=value ] 
      
Specifies the significance level to use as a cutoff value to decide whether or not the series needs differencing.

[Syntax: COMPONENT=(components) ] 
      
Specifies COMPONENT= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Tests which components and/or variances are significant in the model.  This option is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Tests if an autoregreesive component is significant in the model.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Tests if two cycle components are significant in the model.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Tests if a dependent lag component is significant in the model.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Tests if an irregular component is significant in the model.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Tests if a level component is significant in the model.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Tests if a season component is significant in the model.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Tests if a slope component is significant in the model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SIGLEVEL=value ] 
      
Specifies the significance level to use as a cutoff value to decide which
component and/or variances are significant.

[Syntax: REFINEPARMS= ( SIGLEVEL= | FACTOR=(ALL | EVENT | INPUT) | FIRST=EVENT | INPUT) ] 
      
Specifies to refine insignificant parameters of the final model, identify the
factors to refine, and identify the order of factors.
